results.title: Gifted kids
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Kay Donovan
results.brief_description: Grace and Billy Tao are Australian parents of three extremely gifted sons. Terry (14) is a Maths whiz who began university studies at age 9. His younger brother, Trevor (12), was born autistic but as a young child revealed an exceptional talent as a musician. The youngest, Nigel (10) is an all rounder but his IQ is still far higher than the national average. The Tao boys are shown at home and school and discuss how being recognised as a “gifted child” affects their lives. Includes interviews with their parents and teachers.

results.title: Gift of life
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Don Murray
results.brief_description: An account of the collections of blood from donors and its use in hospitals. Stresses the need for blood for transfusions every hour as part of medical service today; the procedure of voluntary donation, facilities provided and the careful labelling, testing and typing carried out by the Red Cross staff; the method of refrigerated storage and transport; use of separated components; an operation in process with the assistance of blood transfusions.

results.title: Gift of earth Fiji
results.brief_description: Shows the attractive sights available to tourists in Fiji. Shows both the natural beauty of the island and the customs and traditional celebrations of the inhabitants.

results.title: Gift for music
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Peter Plummer
results.brief_description: A visit to Chetham’s School of Music in Manchester, the first national co-educational school. Includes interviews with children who attend the school and discusses the problem of those who would like to study there but cannot. Considers the raising of school funds to educate talented children.

results.title: Gidget goes to Rome
results.creator_credit: Jerry Bresler Productions, Jerry Bresler and Paul Wendkos
results.brief_description: Gidget Goes to Rome is the third film to be made inspired by the sun-happy and beach-loving characters created by Frederick Kohner in the mid 50s. In this film, Francie “Gidget” Lawrence goes to Italy with her boyfriend, Moondoggie, and their friends for a whirlwind tour of Rome. Although chaperoned by Aunt Albertina, the two aren’t stopped from experiencing brief extracurricular flirtations. Cast includes: Cindy Carol, James Darren, Jesse Royce Landis, Cesare Danova, Danielle de Metz and Joby Baker.

results.title: Gidget goes Hawaiian
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Jerry Bresler Productions, Jerry Bresler and Paul Wendkos
results.brief_description: Francie Lawrence, better known as Gidget, is off on a Hawaiian holiday with her parents after being disappointed in love by her surfing boyfriend, Moondoggie. Gidget manages to conquer the boys on Waikiki with her good looks, dancing ability and naturally, her surfing prowess, but complications ensue when Moondoggie arrives unannounced. Gidget finds herself caught in a love triangle involving Moondoggie and newcomer dancing stud, Eddie Horner. Things get even worse when jealous rival, Abbey, starts a vicious rumour about Gidget having had “an unfortunate experience”, which causes an even bigger stir with her parents. Cast includes Deborah Walley, James Darren and Michael Callan.

results.title: Gideon's trumpet
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and Sidney Galanty
results.brief_description: This is the story of a trial that actually took place in a quiet southeast part of the United States. The accused, Clarence Earl Gideon, a friendless drifter, launched a strange two year battle that would change the law. Based on the book by Anthony Lewis.

results.title: Gibraltar: Gateway to the Mediterranean
results.brief_description: The present political and economic situation in Gibraltar. Highlights historic events; emphasises the strategic importance ; its development as a naval base and the value of tis airstrip. Discusses the controversy with Spain. Shows familiar tourist attractions.

results.title: Giantland
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Walt Disney and Burt Gillett
results.brief_description: Mickey tells a crowd of orphans a version of “Jack and the Beanstalk” in which he plays the leading role and takes on Rumplewatt, the “king of the giants - prince of the tyrants.”

results.title: Giant turtles
results.brief_description: Shows sea turtles coming ashore by night to lay their eggs before returning to the water. Also shows the hatching of the baby turtles two months later and their instinctive race for the water.
